snippet.title: iPhone 5, Galaxy S3 named in upcoming Apple-Samsung trial
snippet.description: Both Apple and Samsung plan to assert that the other has violated their patented technologies in a trial set for next month.

snippet.title: Telstra world first LTE-B trial at MCG tonight
Apple v. Samsung: All you need to know about latest patent trial (FAQ)
snippet.description: The rivals will return to the courtroom on Monday. The trial is still all about smartphone and tablet patents, but this time, the accused devices are newer, including the Galaxy S3 and iPhone 4S.

snippet.title: Beats Music turns 7 out of 10 free-trial users to paying ones?
snippet.description: The new subscription music service is getting more than 70 percent of free-trial users to pay once the introductory period lapses, according to a Bloomberg report.

snippet.title: Judge denies Samsung motion to stay Apple patent damages trial
snippet.description: Korean electronics giant sought halt to proceedings so that the Patent Office could examine a key patent's validity.

snippet.title: Apple demands $380M in patent trial, but Samsung wants to pay $52M
snippet.description: The amount requested by Apple during opening arguments in a damages retrial is less than the $450 million awarded by a jury last year. And Samsung's proposal is much lower.

snippet.title: Apple v. Samsung trial redux: What you need to know (FAQ)
snippet.description: A judge in March ordered a retrial to recalculate damages Samsung has to pay Apple for patent infringement. The new trial kicks off Tuesday.

snippet.title: Zimmerman trial disrupted by contemptuous Skype-callers
snippet.description: As a professor gives evidence to the Zimmerman trial via Skype, he gets bombarded by those who think it's funny to call him and block the screen.

snippet.title: Apple faces off with DOJ in e-books trial
snippet.description: The U.S. Department of Justice and Apple delivered opening statements in court Monday. Sumi Das speaks to CNET's Josh Lowensohn about why Apple turned down a settlement, and how it might defend itself against allegations of fixing prices on e-books.

snippet.title: Samsung denied new trial over Apple's 'bounce-back' patent
snippet.description: Amid planning for the damages retrial, Judge Koh rules that there will not be another new trial over the '381 patent.
